meanings.definition: A type of sponge characterized by having a body with a single cavity lined with choanocytes.
meanings.sent1: The leucons in the ocean filter water to obtain food.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study leucons to understand their unique body structure.
meanings.sent3: The leucons had a party in their single cavity, dancing to the rhythm of the choanocytes.
meanings.sent4: The leucons stood out in the sea like tiny filters, purifying the water around them.
meanings.sent5: As I observed the leucons, their single cavity lined with choanocytes fascinated me.

meanings.definition: The plural form of leucon, referring to multiple sponges with a body structure consisting of a single cavity lined with choanocytes.
meanings.sent1: Divers marveled at the beauty of the leucons they encountered on their expedition.
meanings.sent2: The aquarium displayed a variety of leucons for visitors to admire.
meanings.sent3: During the sponge race, the leucons cheered for their friends with enthusiasm.
meanings.sent4: The leucons clustered together, creating a stunning display of unity in the ocean.
meanings.sent5: The ocean floor was adorned with colorful leucons, each with a single cavity lined with choanocytes.
